front.div:
Abstract
We have investigated in detail certain rich structures in the Sherman function S arising when
spin-polarized electrons are elastically scattered from the heavy noble gases, krypton and
xenon. These structures exhibit large magnitudes which span several degrees of the scattering
angle and change significantly as the incident electron energy varies. We follow the evolution
of these structures as a function of energy both theoretically and experimentally and compare
with published data.
